roAppInfo.name: roAppInfo
roAppInfo.description:
roAppInfo retrieves the developer ID, which can be useful during development. It also retrieves manifest values, such as the title and version number, avoiding the need to parse the manifest file from BrightScript.
This object is created with no parameters.

roAppManager.name: roAppManager
roAppManager.description: The Application Manager APIs set application level attributes, which mostly affect the look-and-feel of the application. The use of screen styles gives each application a consistent look-and-feel, but it's often desirable to customize attributes such as colors, fonts, and logos for each application. Setting artwork and colors allows the developer to specify a theme for their application. If these values are not set, the application will use default values.

roArray.name: roArray
roArray.description: An array stores an indexed collection of BrightScript objects. Each entry of an array can be a different type, or they may all of the same type.

roAssociativeArray.name: roAssociativeArray
roAssociativeArray.description: An associative array (also known as a map, dictionary or hash table) allows objects to be associated with string keys. Associative arrays are built into the language. They can be accessed implicitly by using the dot or bracket operators, or by calling functions from the ifAssociativeArray interface. For example, the last three lines in this example are equivalent:

roAudioGuide.name: roAudioGuide
roAudioGuide.description: The roAudioGuide component provides Audio Guide support for applications that require custom speech beyond what is provided by automatic Audio Guide in SDK and Scene Graph components.

roAudioMetadata.name: roAudioMetadata
roAudioMetadata.description: The roAudioMetadata component provides developers access to audio file metadata included in many audio files. This should enable some audiofiles to deliver the information needed to fill out an roSpringboard screen without passing the info in a separate xml feed. roAudioMetadata currently only works with local file URLs.

roAudioPlayer.name: roAudioPlayer
roAudioPlayer.description: The Audio Player object provides the ability to setup the playing of a series of audio streams. The object accepts an array of content meta-data objects, describing the audio and providing URLs for accessing each stream. The component understands the following streamformat values: "mp3", "wma", "mp4", "hls", "es.aac-adts", "flac."

roAudioResource.name: roAudioResource
roAudioResource.description: The roAudioResouce allows .wav files to be cached to memory and quickly played at any time. roAudioResource is intended to support short audio clips which need to be played with very little latency. The system caches the entire wav file in memory so that playback can begin very quickly.

roBitmap.name: roBitmap
roBitmap.description: The roBitmap component contains image data and provides an interface (ifDraw2D) for drawing. Bitmaps can be used for a variety of purposes, such as for sprites, compositing, or as double buffers.

roBoolean.name: roBoolean
roBoolean.description: roBoolean is the object equivalent for intrinsic type Boolean.

roByteArray.name: roByteArray
roByteArray.description: The byte array component is used to contain and manipulate an arbitrary array of bytes.

roCaptionRenderer.name: roCaptionRenderer
roCaptionRenderer.description: The roCaptionRenderer component provides a mechanism for BrightScript channels to render closed captions in video played back with the roVideoPlayer. Prior to the v 5.2 Roku firmware, captions could only be rendered in roVideoScreen.

roChannelStore.name: roChannelStore
roChannelStore.description: The roChannelStore component allows the application to perform a purchase of an In-Channel Product or upgrade a channel. Most of the purchase flow, screens and messaging associated with the financial transaction are handled by the Roku OS outside of control or monitoring by BrightScript code. The BrightScript code merely initiates the purchase and receives a final result. This will engender trust with users and give them confidence that they are dealing with the Roku Channel Store.

roCodeRegistrationScreen.name: roCodeRegistrationScreen
roCodeRegistrationScreen.description: The Code Registration Screen is designed to present the user a registration code, and the information required to instruct the user on how to register with a service provider. This screen is designed for a rendezvous registration process, where the user is presented a code and the URL for a registration site. The user goes to the site and enters their code, which causes the device and the account to be linked. In the background, the script is polling for completion and the screen is closed to display an activation successful screen when done.

roCompositor.name: roCompositor
roCompositor.description: The roCompositor allows the composition and animation of multiple roBitmaps and roRegions.

roDataGramSocket.name: roDataGramSocket
roDataGramSocket.description: The roDataGramSocket component enables Brightscript apps to send and receive UDP packets. The interface is modeled on and works much like standard Berkeley sockets.

roDateTime.name: roDateTime
roDateTime.description: The roDateTime provides an interface to obtain the current date/time for the player and manipulate date/times.

roDeviceInfo.name: roDeviceInfo
roDeviceInfo.description: The Device Info provides an interface to obtain attributes about the device.

roDouble.name: roDouble
roDouble.description: roDouble is the object equivalent for intrinsic type 'Double'.

roDeviceCrypto.name: roDeviceCrypto
roDeviceCrypto.description: The roDeviceCrypto component enables you to encrypt and decrypt data on a device using a key that is unique per channel, device, or model. Using a channel key for example, you can encrypt data for a channel so that it may only be decrypted by that same channel. In this case, you could provision credentials or an API key from the cloud to devices securely. With a device key for example, you could implement a secure-storage like algorithm.

roEVPCipher.name: roEVPCipher
roEVPCipher.description: The EVP Cipher component provides an interface to the OpenSSL EVP library of symmetric cipher commands. The EVP library provides a high-level interface to cryptographic functions to implement digital "envelopes".

roEVPDigest.name: roEVPDigest
roEVPDigest.description: The EVP Digest component provides an interface to the OpenSSL EVP library of message digest algorithms. The EVP library provides a high-level interface to cryptographic hash functions.

roFileSystem.name: roFileSystem
roFileSystem.description: The roFilesystem component implements common filesystem inspection and modificationroutines.

roFloat.name: roFloat
roFloat.description: roFloat is the object equivalent for intrinsic type 'Float'.

roFont.name: roFont
roFont.description: roFont represents a particular font, from a font-family (eg. Arial), with a particular pixel size (e.g 20), and a particular boldness or italicness.

roFontMetrics.name: roFontMetrics
roFontMetrics.description: The roFontMetrics object allows you to get display size information for a specific font returned by the roFontRegistry.Get() method.

roFontRegistry.name: roFontRegistry
roFontRegistry.description: The roFontRegistry object allows you to create roFont objects, either using the default font or using fonts in TrueType or OpenType files packaged with your application.

roFunction.name: roFunction
roFunction.description: roFunction is the object equivalent for intrinsic type Function.

roGridScreen.name: roGridScreen
roGridScreen.description: The Grid Screen provides a graphical display of poster art from multiple content categories from within a single screen.

roHdmiStatus.name: roHdmiStatus
roHdmiStatus.description: The HDMI status component provides an interface to the current HDMI operational status.

roHMAC.name: roHMAC
roHMAC.description: The HMAC component provides an interface to the OpenSSL HMAC functions. These functions generate a Message Authentication Code (MAC) based on a key, in such a way that no one without the key could plausibly generate the MAC. HMAC uses a digest (hash) algorithm to generate the MAC.

roHttpAgent.name: roHttpAgent
roHttpAgent.description: All SceneGraph nodes can use the roHttpAgent component to support cookies, custom HTTP headers, and support secure HTTP file transfer protocols, such as passing certificates to the server as part of a URL transfer. An roHttpAgent component object is created by default for all SceneGraph nodes for this purpose. The roHttpAgent object supports the ifHttpAgent interface used by many BrightScript components to allow secure HTTP file transfer protocols. Child nodes of a SceneGraph node automatically inherit the parent roHttpAgent object, unless a new roHttpAgent object is created, or an existing roHttpAgent is set for a child node. There are two roSGNode ifSGNodeHttpAgentAccess interface methods that allow a specific roHttpAgent object to be selected and set for a specific SceneGraph node.

roImageCanvas.name: roImageCanvas
roImageCanvas.description: The roImageCanvas component provides an interface to render graphic elements at specific spots on the screen.

roImageMetaData.name: roImageMetadata
roImageMetaData.description: The roImageMetadata component provides developers access to image file metadata included in many .jpg EXIF headers.

roInput.name: roInput
roInput.description: An roInput object can be used to receive events sent from a network client using the External Control Protocol (ECP), as described in External Control API.

roInt.name: roInt
roInt.description: roInt is the object equivalent for intrinsic type Integer.

roInvalid.name: roInvalid
roInvalid.description: roInvalid is the object equivalent for intrinsic type 'Invalid'.

roKeyboardScreen.name: roKeyboardScreen
roKeyboardScreen.description: The Keyboard Screen is designed to allow the user to enter an alpha-numeric string for searching, username/password registration or other purposes.

roList.name: roList
roList.description: The list object implements the interfaces: ifList, ifArray, ifEnum and therefore can behave like an array that can dynamically add members. The array operator [ ] can be used to access any element in the ordered list.

roListScreen.name: roListScreen
roListScreen.description: The List Screen provides a graphical display of content in a vertical list within a single screen.

roLocalization.name: roLocalization
roLocalization.description: The roLocalization object provides functions to assist in localization. This object provides functions to assist in localization.

roLongInteger.name: roLongInteger
roLongInteger.description: roLongInteger is the object name corresponding to the intrinsic LongInteger object.

roMessageDialog.name: roMessageDialog
roMessageDialog.description: The Message Dialog displays a formatted, multi-line text message to the user. The dialog may optionally be displayed with a busy animation to indicate progress on a long running operation. The dialog will automatically handle formatting of text and resize to fit. It may also display buttons to get user acknowledgment or a selection choice.

roMessagePort.name: roMessagePort
roMessagePort.description: A Message Port is the place messages (events) are sent.

roMicrophone.name: roMicrophone
roMicrophone.description: The roMicrophone API allows channel applications to receive audio data from the users microphone-supported remote control device or mobile phone. When a user initiates recording on their remote control device or mobile phone (via the Roku Mobile App) for the first time within the application, the application will request the users permission for the application to access the microphone by displaying a UI dialog box.

roOneLineDialog.name: roOneLineDialog
roOneLineDialog.description: The One Line Dialog is a special type of dialog optimized for single line text.

roParagraphScreen.name: roParagraphScreen
roParagraphScreen.description: The Paragraph Screen provides a way to display text and selection choices to the user.

roPath.name: roPath
roPath.description: The roPath component provides developers an easy way to create valid file system paths.

roPinEntryDialog.name: roPinEntryDialog
roPinEntryDialog.description: The Pin Entry Dialog is designed to allow the user to enter a numeric PIN for purchasing content.

roPosterScreen.name: roPosterScreen
roPosterScreen.description: This object is created with no parameters:

roProgramGuide.name: roProgramGuide
roProgramGuide.description: Represents Electronic Program Guide (EPG) information from the tuner.

roRegex.name: roRegex
roRegex.description: The roRegex component provides the powerful regular expression processing of the PCRE library to Brightscript strings.

roRegion.name: roRegion
roRegion.description: The roRegion component is used to represent a subsection of a bitmap.

roRegistry.name: roRegistry
roRegistry.description: The Registry is an area of non-volatile storage where a small number of persistent settings can be stored.

roRegistrySection.name: roRegistrySection
roRegistrySection.description: A Registry Section enables the organization of settings within the registry. Different registry sections may have their own keys with the same name. In other words, key names are scoped within the registry section to which they belong.

roRSA.name: roRSA
roRSA.description: The RSA component provides an interface to the OpenSSL RSA library of signing algorithms.

roScreen.name: roScreen
roScreen.description: The roScreen component provides a full screen drawing surface that can be stacked and that you can receive input events from.

roSearchHistory.name: roSearchHistory
roSearchHistory.description: The Search History object implements the system wide storage of search terms for use in implementing the roSearchScreen.

roSearchScreen.name: roSearchScreen
roSearchScreen.description: The Search Screen provides a standard way to allow users to enter text for searching.

roSGNode.name: roSGNode

roSGScreen.name: roSGScreen
roSGScreen.description:
The roSGScreen object is a SceneGraph canvas that displays the
contents of a SceneGraph Scene node instance. The object is created
by calling:

roSlideShow.name: roSlideShow
roSlideShow.description: The Slide Show screen provides the ability to setup a photo slide show to playback a series of images.

roSocketAddress.name: roSocketAddress
roSocketAddress.description: The roSocketAddress is used by the roStreamSocket and roDataGramSocket components for TCP and UDP traffic respectively.

roSpringboardScreen.name: roSpringboardScreen
roSpringboardScreen.description: The Springboard Screen shows detailed information about an individual piece of content and provides options for actions that may be taken on that content.

roSprite.name: roSprite
roSprite.description: The roSprite object cannot be created directly with a CreateObject() call. It must be associated with a managing roCompositor object. This association is implicitly created by creating an roSprite object with the roCompositor methods NewSprite() or NewAnimatedSprite().

roStreamSocket.name: roStreamSocket
roStreamSocket.description: The roStreamSocket component enables BrightScript apps to accept and connect to TCP streams as well as send and receive data with them. The interface is modeled on and works much like standard Berkeley sockets.

roString.name: roString
roString.description: roString is the object equivalent for intrinsic type 'String'.

roSystemlog.name: roSystemLog
roSystemlog.description: The roSystemLog component enables the application to receive events from the Roku Streaming Player that are intended for reporting errors and trends, rather than trigger a response to a user action.

roTextScreen.name: roTextScreen
roTextScreen.description: roTextScreen provides a way of displaying large amounts of scrollable text.

roTextToSpeech.name: roTextToSpeech
roTextToSpeech.description: The roTextToSpeech component provides text to speech capabilities to applications.

roTextureManager.name: roTextureManager
roTextureManager.description: The Texture Manager provides a set of API's for managing an roBitmap cache.

roTextureRequest.name: roTextureRequest
roTextureRequest.description: An roTextureRequest is used to make requests to the roTextureManager.

roTimespan.name: roTimespan
roTimespan.description: The Timespan object provides an interface to a simple timer for tracking the duration of activities. It's useful for tracking how an action has taken or if a specified time has elapsed from some starting event.

roUrlTransfer.name: roUrlTransfer
roUrlTransfer.description: A roUrlTransfer object transfers data to or from remote servers specified by URLs. It can perform mutual authentication with a web server.

roVideoPlayer.name: roVideoPlayer
roVideoPlayer.description: The roVideoPlayer component implements a video player with more programmatic control, but less user control than the roVideoScreen component.

roVideoScreen.name: roVideoScreen
roVideoScreen.description: The Video Screen object implements the video playback portion of the user interface.

roXMLElement.name: roXMLElement
roXMLElement.description: roXMLElement is used to contain an XML tree.

roXMLList.name: roXMLList
roXMLList.description: Contains a list of roXML objects.

methods.name: GetID

methods.name: GetSubtitle

methods.returnDescription: Possible subtitle configuration

methods.name: GetDevID
methods.description: Returns the app's developer ID, or the keyed developer ID, if the application is sideloaded.
methods.returnDescription: Channel's Developer ID

params.name: key
params.description: The manifest value to be returned.

ifAppManager.name: ifAppManager

methods.name: SetTheme

params.name: attributeArray
params.description: The attributeArray is an [roAssociativeArray](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roassociativearray.md "roAssociativeArray") of attribute/value pairs. The program may create the roAssociativeArray at runtime or read it from an XML file using the [roXMLElement](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roxmlelement.md "roXMLElement") object. Existing values for attributes will be overwritten by the values provided. Any values set by a previous SetTheme or SetThemeAttribute call, but not included in the array currently provided by with the subsequent call will remain unchanged. See [roAppManager](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roappmanager.md "roAppManager") the list of valid attributes.

methods.description: Sets a group of theme attributes for the application.

methods.name: SetThemeAttribute

params.name: attributeName
params.description: The attributeName is the name of one of the settable theme attributes and the value is the desired setting. If the attributeName is not valid, no action is performed.

params.name: attributeValue
params.description: This attributeValue will override the default value for that attribute or modify the value provided by a previous SetTheme or SetThemeAttribute call to the new value provided.

methods.description: Set an individual theme attribute for the application.

methods.name: ClearThemeAttribute

params.name: attributeName
params.description: The theme attribute to be cleared.

methods.description: Clears a previously set attribute and reverts to its default value.

methods.name: GetUptime
methods.description: Returns an [roTimespan](/docs/references/brightscript/components/rotimespan.md "roTimespan") object, which is "marked" when the user clicked on the application button on the home screen.Calling the TotalMilliseconds() method on the returned roTimespan object returns the total number of milliseconds since the application started.
methods.returnDescription: An [roTimespan](/docs/references/brightscript/components/rotimespan.md "roTimespan") object.

methods.name: GetScreensaverTimeout
methods.description: Returns the user's screensaver wait time setting in number of minutes, or zero if the screensaver is disabled.
methods.returnDescription: The number of minutes set for the screensaver wait time.

methods.name: SetUserSignedIn

params.name: signedIn
params.description: Set to true to indicate that the user is signed in; set to false to indicate the user is signed out.

methods.description: This method allows a channel to tell Roku when the user is signed in or signed out of the channelIf the channel is removed, the Roku OS will call SetUserSignedIn(false) on the channel's behalf.

methods.name: SetAutomaticAudioGuideEnabled

params.name: enabled
params.description: A flag indicating whether to enable or disable the automatic audio guide.

methods.description: Enables or disables automatic Audio Guide and override any manifest setting.This is useful for channels that want to temporarily turn off automatic Audio Guide for specific screens.

methods.name: LaunchApp

params.name: channelID
params.description: The unique ID of the channel to be launched.

params.name: version
params.description: The minimum version of the channel required to launch the channel. If the specified version (or later) is not being used, the channel is not launched. To skip the version check, pass an empty string.

params.name: params
params.description: Key-value pairs specifying the playback experience upon launching the channel.

methods.description: Launches the channel with the specified channelID and the specified version, with the playback experience upon launching the channel based on the provided params.

methods.name: ShowChannelStoreSpringboard

params.name: channelID
params.description: The unique ID of the channel to be launched.

methods.description: Launches the channel store springboard of the specified channel. The channel store springboard contains detailed information about the channel, including ratings, version, date of last update, developer name, and a description.

methods.name: IsAppInstalled

params.name: channelID
params.description: The unique id of the channel.

params.name: version
params.description: The minimum version number of the channel to be used for the query.

methods.description: This method returns true if a channel with the specified channelID and the minimum version required is installed.
methods.returnDescription: A boolean indicating whether the specified channel is installed.

methods.name: SetNowPlayingContentMetaData

params.name: contentMetaData
params.description: The video or audio [content metadata](/docs/developer-program/getting-started/architecture/content-metadata.md) parameters to be updated (for example, the title and contentType)

methods.description: Updates video or audio [content metadata](/docs/developer-program/getting-started/architecture/content-metadata.md) during playback. This method takes a subset of content metadata parameters to be updated. These values override any previously ones sent to the Roku Media Player, and they are used until this function is called again or until the [**roAppManager**](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roappmanager.md) instance is deleted.

ifArray.name: ifArray

methods.name: Peek
methods.description: Returns the last (highest index) array entry without removing it. If the array is empty, returns invalid
methods.returnDescription: Invalid

methods.name: Pop
methods.description: Returns the last entry (highest index) from the array and removes it from the array. If the array is empty, returns invalid and does not change the array.
methods.returnDescription: The last (highest index) array entry.

methods.name: Push

params.name: tvalue
params.description: The value to be added to the beginning of the array.

methods.description: Adds the specified value to the end of the array.

methods.name: Shift
methods.description: Removes the first entry (zero index) from the beginning of the array and shifts the other entries up. This method is similar to the [Pop method](#pushtvalue-as-dynamic-as-void), but removes the first entry in the array instead of the last.
methods.returnDescription: The first entry (zero index) removed from the array.

methods.name: Unshift

params.name: tvalue
params.description: The value to be added to the beginning of the array.

methods.description: Adds the specified value to the beginning of the array (at the zero index) and shifts the other entries down. This method is similar to the [Push method](#push-as-dynamic), but removes the first entry in the array instead of the last.

methods.name: Delete
methods.description: Deletes the indicated array entry, and shifts all entries up. This decreases the array length by one.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the specified array entry has been removed. If the entry was successfully deleted, returns true. If index is out of range, returns false and does not change the array.

methods.name: Count
methods.description: Returns the length of the array, which is one more than the index of highest entry.
methods.returnDescription: The length of the array.

methods.name: Clear
methods.description: Deletes all the entries in the array.

methods.name: Append

params.name: array
params.description: The **roArray** to be appended to the target array.

methods.description: Appends the entries in one **roArray** to another. If the passed array contains entries that have not been set to a value, they are not appended.

ifAssociativeArray.name: ifAssociativeArray

methods.name: AddReplace

params.name: key
params.description: The key to be added to the associative array.

params.name: value
params.description: The value of the key to be added to the associative array.

methods.description: Adds a new entry to the array associating the supplied value with the supplied key string. Only one value may be associated with a key. If the key is already associated with a value, the existing value is discarded.

methods.name: Lookup

params.name: key
params.description: The key associated with the value to be retrieved from the associative array.

methods.description: Returns the value in the array associated with the specified key. The key comparison is case-insensitive, unless the **SetModeCaseSensitive()** method has been called.
methods.returnDescription: Returns the value in the array associated with the specified key. If there is no value associated with the key, the type "invalid" is returned.

methods.name: LookupCI

params.name: key
params.description: The key (case-insensitive) associated with the value to be retrieved from the associative array.

methods.description: Same as the [Lookup()](#lookupkey-as-string-as-dynamic) method except that the key comparison is always case insensitive, regardless of the case mode.
methods.returnDescription: Returns the value in the array associated with the specified key. If there is no value associated with the key, the type "invalid" is returned.

methods.name: DoesExist

params.name: key
params.description: The key associated with the entry to be checked.

methods.description: Looks for an entry in the associative array associated with the specified key.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether an entry is associated with the specified key exists. If there is no associated object then false is returned. If there is such an object then true is returned.

methods.name: Delete

params.name: key
params.description: The key associated with the entry to be deleted.

methods.description: Deletes an entry from an associative array based on the key.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether an entry is associated with the specified key exists. If there is no associated object then false is returned. If there is such an object then true is returned.

methods.name: Clear
methods.description: Remove all key/values from the associative array.

methods.name: Keys
methods.description: Returns an array containing the associative array keys in lexicographical order.
methods.returnDescription: An array of associative array keys.

methods.name: Items
methods.description: Returns an array containing the associative array key/value pairs in lexicographical order of key.
methods.returnDescription: An array of associative array keys/value pairs.

methods.name: SetModeCaseSensitive
methods.description: Makes all subsequent associative array lookups case sensitive (by default, lookups are case insensitive).

methods.name: Append

params.name: aa
params.description: The associative array to be appended to the calling object.

methods.description: Appends an associative array to this calling object. If any key in the **aa** parameter is already associated with a value in the calling object, the current value is discarded and is replaced with the value provided in the **aa** parameter.

methods.name: Count
methods.description: Returns the number of keys in the associative array.
methods.returnDescription: The number of keys in the associative array.

implementors.name: roAssociativeArray
implementors.description: An associative array allows objects to be associated with string keys

ifAudioGuide.name: ifAudioGuide

methods.name: Say

params.name: text
params.description: The string to be spoken.

params.name: flushSpeech
params.description: Set to true to make the Audio Guide immediately stop speaking any other speech before speaking.

params.name: dontRepeat
params.description: Set to true to ignore calls to the say() method with the same text.

methods.description: Returns an ID for the spoken string to notify observer callbacks about a specific spoken string. This ID can be used with the [roTextToSpeechEvent](/docs/references/brightscript/events/rotexttospeechevent.md "roTextToSpeechEvent").This method will automatically split up text to reduce lag. Due to this automatic splitting, the roTextToSpeechEvent 0 ("Started speech") event for the returned ID may not be sent until later than expected. The roTextToSpeechEvents 1 ("Speech has completed") and 2 ("Speech has been flushed") events are sent at the expected times.
methods.returnDescription: An ID associated with the spoken string to be used to notify observer callbacks.

methods.name: Flush
methods.description: Interrupts and stops any current text to speech spoken string, to be used when the application does not want the text to speech to continue.

methods.name: Silence

params.name: duration
params.description: The number of milliseconds to suppress application background sounds.

methods.description: If Audio Guide is enabled, causes text to speech to continue to suppress any application background sound for the amount of time specified by duration (in milliseconds).This can be used to add clarity for longer spoken text that may have pauses that might otherwise allow application background sound to be heard. This method does nothing if Audio Guide is currently disabled.
methods.returnDescription: The number of milliseconds that the background sound has been silenced.

implementors.name: roAudioGuide
implementors.description: Returns information about the application

ifAudioGuide.desription: Returns an ID for the spoken string to notify observer callbacks about a specific spoken string. This ID can be used with the roTextToSpeechEvent.This method will automatically split up text to reduce lag. Due to this automatic splitting, the roTextToSpeechEvent 0 ("Started speech") event for the returned ID may not be sent until later than expected. The roTextToSpeechEvents 1 ("Speech has completed") and 2 ("Speech has been flushed") events are sent at the expected times.

ifAudioPlayer.name: ifAudioPlayer

methods.name: SetContentList
methods.description: Sets the content list to be played by the Audio Player.

methods.name: AddContent

params.name: contentItem
params.description: The new ContentMetaData item to be added to the content list.

methods.description: Adds a new ContentMetaData item to the end of the content list for the Audio Player.

methods.name: ClearContent
methods.description: Clears the content list.

methods.name: Play
methods.description: Puts the Audio Player into play mode starting at the current item in the Content List. This will stop any currently playing content.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the Audio Player was successfully set to play mode.

methods.name: Stop
methods.description: Stops the Audio Player from playing or pausing and cleanup.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the Audio Player was successfully stopped.

methods.name: Pause
methods.description: Puts the Audio Player into pause mode. It is an error to Pause if player is not in play mode.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the Audio Player was successfully set to pause mode.

methods.name: Resume
methods.description: Puts the Audio Player into play mode starting from the pause point. It is an error to Resume if the player is not in pause mode.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the Audio Player was successfully set to play mode.

params.name: offsetMs
params.description: The offset to be used to determine the start point of the current content item.

methods.description: Set the start point of playback for the current item to offsetMs milliseconds.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the Audio Player was successfully set to the specified offset.

methods.description: Specifies the timedMetaData keys that the channel is interested in receiving from the timedMetaData event.

params.description: The [roScreen](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roscreen.md) or [roImageCanvas](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roimagecanvas.md) instance to be associated with this caption renderer.

In this case, the Roku OS is responsible for all of the closed caption text rendering, and thus must know what screen to draw on.If the mode is set to 2, the BrightScript channel is responsible for all of the caption drawing, and thus the Roku OS does not need to be informed as to what screen is being rendered on.

methods.name: SetMessagePort
methods.description: Sets the [roMessagePort](/docs/references/brightscript/components/romessageport.md) that should receive [roCaptionRendererEvents](/docs/references/brightscript/events/rocaptionrendererevent.md) from the roCaptionRenderer.

methods.name: ShowSubtitle

params.name: enable
params.description: A flag indicating whether the roCaptionRenderer displays captions.

methods.description: Specifies whether the roCaptionRenderer displays captions. This function behaves the same as [ifVideoScreen.ShowSubtitle()](/docs/references/brightscript/interfaces/ifvideoscreen.md "ifVideoScreen.ShowSubtitle/(/)").

methods.name: UpdateCaption
methods.description: For roCaptionRenderer instances with the mode set to 1, this method tells the Roku OS to render the current caption. If the mode is 2, this function does nothing

methods.name: GetSubtitleTracks
methods.description: Returns an roArray of roAssociativeArrays for each closed caption track found in the stream. This function can also be used to retrieve caption URLs for external (sideloaded) caption files.
methods.returnDescription: Each associative array in the returned array contains track information similar to that specified in the SubtitleTracks content metadata structure:

methods.name: ChangeSubtitleTrack

params.name: track
params.description: One of the 608 channels or ttml text tracks to be selected. The 608 channels are specified as 'eia608/' where is 1, 2, 3, or 4. The ttml text tracks are specified as 'ism/<track\_name>'.

methods.description: The ChangeSubtitleTrack function is used to change the caption source after playback has begun.

implementors.name: roCaptionRenderer
implementors.description: Returns information about the application

ifCaptionRenderer.desription: Sets the rendering mode for the roCaptionRenderer.

ifChannelStore.name: ifChannelStore

methods.name: GetIdentity
methods.description: Returns a unique number for this object that can be used to identify whether a roChannelStoreEvent event originated from this object, by comparing with the roChannelStoreEvent object's GetSourceIdentity() value.
methods.returnDescription: The unique number generated for the object.

methods.name: GetCatalog
methods.description: Requests the list of In-Channel products that are linked to the running channel.

methods.name: GetStoreCatalog
methods.description: Requests the list of globally available In-Channel products, which are available to all channels.

methods.name: GetPurchases
methods.description: Requests the list of purchases associated with the current user account.

methods.name: SetOrder

params.name: order
params.description: Each roAssociativeArray in the roList contains the following fields:

methods.description: Sets the current Order (shopping cart) to the elements specified in the parameter, which must be an roList of roAssociativeArray items.Passing an empty roList clears the Order, like calling ClearOrder().

methods.name: DeltaOrder

params.name: code
params.description: The product identifier.

params.name: qty
params.description: The quantity purchased. This may be a negative number.

methods.description: Applies a change in quantity to one item in the current Order (shopping cart).

methods.name: GetOrder
methods.description: Retrieves the current Order.
methods.returnDescription: The returned object is an roList of roAssociativeArray items, where each item contains the following parameter names with specified value type:

methods.name: DoOrder
methods.description: Displays the Roku Channel Store Product Purchase Screen populated with information from the current Order.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the user approved the order (true if the order was approved; false otherwise).

methods.name: FakeServer

params.name: enable
params.description: If enable is true, enables a test mode for the roChannelStore component.

methods.description: This test mode short circuits communication to the Roku Channel store. It makes other methods get their responses to async queries and operations from configuration files, rather than actual server communication.

methods.name: GetUserData
methods.description: The GetUserData() function provides a way to request user authorization to share the users account information with the calling channel.
methods.returnDescription: When called, the method presents a dialog screen containing the users account information, along with two buttons labeled Share and Dont Share.

methods.name: GetPartialUserData

params.name: properties
params.description: A comma-separated list of the attribute names to be returned. For example, to return only the email address and first name of the user's account, you would call GetPartialUserData("email, firstname"). The full set of user account properties that can be queried with the function is:

methods.description: This function works like GetUserData(), but allows the caller to specify which user data elements to return. The specified values are also displayed in the user data dialog screen.
methods.returnDescription: An roAssociativeArray containing the Roku account information passed in the method.

methods.name: GetUserRegionData
methods.description: Retrieves the state, zip code, and country associated with the customer's Roku account. The location information returned by this command can be used to determine a customer's eligibility for regional-specific subscription products and content.
methods.returnDescription: An associative array that contains the following fields:

methods.name: StoreChannelCredData

params.name: data
params.description: An OAuth token, custom token, or other custom data to be stored.

methods.description: Stores an access token, oAuth token, or other authentication artifact that can be retrieved by calling the [GetChannelCred()](/docs/references/brightscript/interfaces/ifchannelstore.md#getchannelcred-as-object)method. This data is stored securely in the Roku cloud and can be retrieved by other devices linked to the same Roku account. This method can be used to store an authentication artifact with Roku for a signed in user, associating that user with a particular Roku account. For more information, see [Automatic Account Link](/docs/developer-program/authentication/universal-authentication-protocol-for-single-sign-on.md).
methods.returnDescription: This command returns an roAssociativeArray with the following values:

methods.name: GetChannelCred
methods.description: Retrieves a Roku Partner Unique Customer Identifier (roku\_pucid), or retrieves an access token, oAuth token, or other authentication artifact (channel\_data).
methods.returnDescription: An associative array that contains the following fields:

implementors.name: roChannelStore
implementors.description: allows the application to perform a purchase of an In-Channel Product or upgrade a channel

ifChannelStore.desription: Returns a unique number for this object that can be used to identify whether a roChannelStoreEvent event originated from this object, by comparing with the roChannelStoreEvent object's GetSourceIdentity() value.

ifCodeRegistrationScreen.name: ifCodeRegistrationScreen

methods.name: SetTitle

params.name: title
params.description: The title to be displayed on the code registration screen.

methods.description: Sets the title for the screen to the specified string.

methods.name: AddHeaderText

params.name: text
params.description: The text to be displayed in the header of the code registration screen.

methods.description: Add a string of bold, high visibility text to the screen as a header to introduce the subsequent paragraph(s).

methods.name: AddParagraph

params.name: text
params.description: The paragraph of text to be displayed on the code registration screen.

methods.description: Adds a paragraph of text to the screen. A paragraph is specified as a single string and are ordered on the screen in the same order as they are added. The roCodeRegistrationScreen handles all text formatting and justification. Spacing is automatically inserted between paragraphs for readability.

methods.name: AddButton

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the button.

params.name: title
params.description: The title of the button.

methods.description: Adds a button to the screen identified by the title and ID provided. The buttons are at the bottom of the screen and appear in the order added
methods.returnDescription: When the button is pressed, the script will receive an event from the application indicating the ID of the button pressed.

methods.name: AddFocalText

params.name: text
params.description: This text is intended to provide the user important instructions on where to use the registration code. It is generally a few words of instruction followed by the URL for the registration site on the web.

params.name: spacingFormat
params.description: Multiple lines of text may be added and the spacing between each is controlled by specifying the spacing format as one of the following: spacing-dense, spacingnormal or spacing-sparse.

methods.description: Adds high visibility focal text to the screen to be placed above the registration code.

methods.name: SetBreadcrumbText

params.name: String
params.description: The second location value.

methods.description: Breadcrumbs allow the application to display a two-part navigational title which shows the current and the previous locations in the application hierarchy (e.g. TV  Friends). If both location values are set, the application will display the title in breadcrumb format. If only the first location is set, the application will display the specified text in the title area like the SetTitle API call

methods.name: SetRegistrationCode
methods.description: Sets the registration code (e.g. XM3RT) or text (e.g. retrieving) to be displayed on the screen.

methods.name: Show
methods.description: Displays or refreshes the screen after creation or state changes.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the screen is displayed (returns true if the screen is displayed, otherwise false).

methods.name: Close
methods.description: Closes the screen and deletes the associated object. This is useful for avoiding screen flicker when the display order of your screens does not resemble a stack.

implementors.name: roCodeRegistrationScreen
implementors.description: The Code Registration Screen is designed to present the user a registration code, and the information required to instruct the user on how to register with a service provider

ifCodeRegistrationScreen.desription: Sets the title for the screen to the specified string.

ifCompositor.name: ifCompositor

methods.name: SetDrawTo

params.name: destBitmap
params.description: The bitmap to be drawn.

params.name: rgbaBackground
params.description: The background color to be used.

methods.description: Sets the destBitmap ([roBitmap](/docs/references/brightscript/components/robitmap.md "roBitmap") or [roScreen](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roscreen.md "roScreen")) and the background color.

methods.name: Draw
methods.description: Draws any dirty sprites (that is, whatever is new or has changed since the last Draw). No compositor or sprite operations will be reflected on the display until Draw() is called. After calling Draw(), you must call Finish() (if single buffered) or SwapBuffers() (if double buffered) before the changes will be user visible

methods.name: DrawAll
methods.description: Redraws all sprites even if not dirty. After calling Draw(), you must call Finish() (if single buffered) or SwapBuffers() (if double buffered) before the changes will be user visible

methods.name: NewSprite

params.name: x
params.description: The x-coordinate of the sprite.

params.name: y
params.description: The y-coordinate of the sprite.

params.name: region
params.description: The region to be used to define the sprite's bitmap.

params.name: z
params.description: The z-coordinate of the sprite.

methods.description: Creates a new sprite, using an roRegion to define the sprite's bitmap. Position the sprite at coordinate x,y. If z is provided, position the sprite in front of all other sprites with equal or lower z value. Sprites with negative z values are not rendered or displayed on the screen.
methods.returnDescription: Returns an [roSprite](/docs/references/brightscript/components/rosprite.md "roSprite") object.

methods.name: NewAnimatedSprite

params.name: x
params.description: The x-coordinate of the sprite.

params.name: y
params.description: The y-coordinate of the sprite.

params.name: regionArray
params.description: The frames to be animated.

params.name: z
params.description: The z-coordinate of the sprite.

methods.description: Creates a new sprite that consists of a sequence of frames to be animated. The frames are defined by the regionArray which is an [roArray](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roarray.md "roArray") of [roRegions](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roregion.md "roRegions"). Position the sprite at coordinate x,y. If z is provided, position the sprite in front of all other sprites with equal or lower z value
methods.returnDescription: Returns an [roSprite](/docs/references/brightscript/components/rosprite.md "roSprite") object.

methods.name: AnimationTick

params.name: duration
params.description: The number of ms since the last call.

methods.description: Moves all animated sprites. Sprites will not animate unless you call this function regularly.

methods.name: ChangeMatchingRegions

params.name: oldRegion
params.description: The sprite roRegion to be replaced.

params.name: newRegion
params.description: The new sprite roRegion to be used.

methods.description: Provides a global search and replace of sprite [roRegions](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roregion.md "roRegions"). Replaces regions that match oldRegion with newRegion

implementors.name: roCompositor
implementors.description: The roCompositor allows the composition and animation of multiple roBitmaps and roRegions

ifCompositor.desription: Sets the destBitmap (roBitmap or roScreen) and the background color.

ifDateTime.name: ifDateTime

methods.name: Mark
methods.description: Sets the date/time value to the current UTC date and time.

methods.name: ToLocalTime
methods.description: Offsets the date/time value from an assumed UTC date/time to a local date/time using the system time zone setting. This function is not idempotent, and multiple calls will do multiple timezone adjustments to the time yielding an incorrect result.

methods.name: GetTimeZoneOffset
methods.description: Returns the offset in minutes from the system time zone to UTC. For example, if the system time zone is in PDT / UTC-7 the value returned would be 420.
methods.returnDescription: Minutes of offset as Integer.

methods.name: AsSeconds
methods.description: Returns the date/time as the number of seconds from the Unix epoch (00:00:00 1/1/1970 GMT).
methods.returnDescription: Number of seconds as Integer.

methods.name: FromSeconds

params.name: numSeconds
params.description: The number of seconds from the Unix epoch.

methods.description: Sets the date/time value using the number of seconds from the Unix epoch.

methods.name: ToISOString
methods.description: Returns an ISO 8601 representation of the date/time value. As of Roku OS 10.0, this now resolves to milliseconds.

methods.name: FromISO8601String

params.name: dateString
params.description: The ISO-8601 string to be used to set the date and time.

methods.description: Sets the date/time using a string in the ISO 8601 format. For example "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS" e.g "2009-01-01 01:00:00.000" or "2009-01-01T01:00:00.000".

methods.name: AsDateString
methods.description: Returns the date/time formatted string.
methods.returnDescription: A dateString corresponding to the specified format.

methods.name: AsDateStringNoParam
methods.description: Returns the date/time in long-date format.
methods.returnDescription: A date/time string in long-date format (for example, Tuesday October 9, 2012)

methods.name: GetWeekday
methods.description: Returns the day of the week.
methods.returnDescription: Week value as a String (e.g. "Monday").

methods.name: GetYear
methods.description: Return Value

methods.name: GetMonth
methods.description: Returns the date/time value's month.
methods.returnDescription: Month value as an Integer (1=Jan, 12=Dec).

methods.name: GetDayOfMonth
methods.description: Returns the date/time value's day of the month.
methods.returnDescription: Month value as an Integer (1-31).

methods.name: GetHours
methods.description: Returns the date/time value's hour within the day.
methods.returnDescription: Hour value as an Integer (0-23)

methods.name: GetMinutes
methods.description: Returns the date/time value's minute within the hour.
methods.returnDescription: Minute value as an Integer (0-59)

methods.name: GetSeconds
methods.description: Returns the date/time value's second within the minute.
methods.returnDescription: Second value as an Integer (0-59).

methods.name: GetMilliseconds
methods.description: Returns the date/time value's millisecond within the second.
methods.returnDescription: Millisecond value as an Integer (0-999).

methods.name: GetLastDayOfMonth
methods.description: Returns the date/time value's last day of the month.
methods.returnDescription: Day as an Integer (28-31)

methods.name: GetDayOfWeek
methods.description: Returns the date/time value's day of week.
methods.returnDescription: Day value as an Integer (Sunday=0, Monday=1, ..., Saturday=6).

implementors.name: roDateTime
implementors.description: The roDateTime provides an interface to obtain the current date/time for the player and manipulate date/times

ifDateTime.desription: Sets the date/time value to the current UTC date and time.

ifDeviceInfo.name: ifDeviceInfo

methods.name: GetModel
methods.description: Returns the model name of the Roku device. See the [Hardware Specification](/docs/specs/hardware.md) for the list of the current, updatable, and legacy Roku models.
methods.returnDescription: A five-character alphanumeric string (for example, "3050X") .

methods.name: GetModelDisplayName
methods.description: Returns the model display name of the Roku device.
methods.returnDescription: The model display name (for example, "Roku 2 XD")

methods.name: GetModelType
methods.description: Returns a string describing the type of device. For future compatibility, the caller should by default assume "STB" when anything other than described value is returned
methods.returnDescription: The device type, which may be one of the following values:

methods.name: GetModelDetails
methods.description: Returns detailed information about the device model.
methods.returnDescription: An associative array containing the following information about the device model:

methods.name: GetFriendlyName
methods.description: Returns a string describing the device that may be used for network device selection. The string is subject to change and should not be used as a persistent key or ID
methods.returnDescription: A user-assigned device name or a description of the device such as model name and/or serial number.

methods.name: GetOSVersion
methods.description: Returns an roAssociativeArray containing the **major**, **minor**, **revision**, and **build** numbers of the Roku OS running on the device.
methods.returnDescription: An roAssociativeArray containing the following fields:

methods.name: GetVersion
methods.description: Returns the version number of the device.
methods.returnDescription: A 13-character string (for example "034.08E01185A"). The third through sixth characters are the major/minor version number ("4.08") and the ninth through twelfth are the build number ("1185")

methods.name: GetDeviceUniqueId
methods.description: Returns a string of 12 zeroes (it no longer returns the unique identifier for the channel on a device).
methods.returnDescription: A string of 12 zeros ("000000000000")

methods.name: GetAdvertisingId
methods.description: Returns a unique identifier for the device. This identifier is persistent but can be reset by the user from the device's Settings menu or by performing a factory reset on the device.
methods.returnDescription: A Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) as specified in IETF-RFC 4122 with 36 characters (32 alphanumeric characters and four hyphens). The characters are grouped in the form 8-4-4-4-12, for example "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426655440000"

methods.name: GetRIDA
methods.description: Returns a unique identifier for the device.
methods.returnDescription: A Universally Unique Identifier (UUID). This identifier is persistent, but it can be reset by the user from the device's **Settings** menu or by performing a factory reset on the device

methods.name: IsAdIdTrackingDisabled
methods.description: If Ad Id tracking is disabled, the identifier returned by GetAdvertisingId() should not be used for Ad targeting
methods.returnDescription: Returns true if the user has disabled Ad Id tracking by selecting "Limit ad tracking" from the Roku Settings menu, false otherwise.

methods.name: IsRIDADisabled
methods.description: Indicates whether tracking via Roku's ID for Advertisers (RIDA) is disabled on the device.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether RIDA tracking is disabled on the device (RIDA tracking can be disabled by selecting "Limit ad tracking" from the **Settings>Privacy>Advertising** menu). If RIDA tracking is disabled, this returns true; false otherwise.

methods.name: GetClientTrackingId
methods.description: Returns a unique identifier for the device.
methods.returnDescription: A unique device identifier. This identifier is different across channels so each channel will get a different identifier when calling this function

methods.name: GetChannelClientId
methods.description: Returns a unique identifier for the device. The ID is persistent and cannot be reset. This value can be used to manage or identify devices linked to the channels content services.
methods.returnDescription: A unique device identifier. This identifier is different across channels so each channel will get a different identifier when calling this function

methods.name: GetUserCountryCode
methods.description: Returns the ISO 3166-1 (2-letter) country code associated with the user's Roku account.
methods.returnDescription: An ISO 3166-1 (2-letter) country code.

methods.name: GetRandomUUID
methods.description: Returns a randomly generated unique identifier. Each time this function is called, a different identifier is returned
methods.returnDescription: A Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) version 4 as specified in IETF-RFC 4122 with 36 characters (32 alphanumeric characters and four hyphens). The characters are grouped in the form 8-4-4-4-12, for example "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426655440000"

methods.name: GetTimeZone
methods.description: Checks for the user's current system time zone setting.
methods.returnDescription: A string representing the user's current system time zone setting. For example, this method may return values such as:

methods.name: HasFeature

params.name: feature
params.description: The feature to be checked, which may be one of the following values:

methods.description: Checks if the current device/firmware supports the passed in feature string.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the current device/firmware supports the passed in feature string.

methods.name: GetCurrentLocale
methods.description: Gets the current locale value based on the user's language setting.
methods.returnDescription: A string representing the current locale based on the user's language setting. The string is an ISO 639-1 (2-letter) language code followed by an underscore and a ISO 3166-1 (2-letter) country code. This may be one of the following values:

methods.name: GetCountryCode
methods.description: Checks for the country code of the channel.
methods.returnDescription: A value that indicates the Roku Channel Store associated with a users Roku account. Typically, the value returned will be an ISO 3166-1 (2-letter) country code representing the country. Alternatively, if the channel owner entered into an additional agreement to have the channel published to a curated [Roku Powered Channel Store](https://www.roku.com/roku-powered) instead of the user country, then a Roku Powered Channel Store Identifier will instead be returned. This may be one of the following values:

methods.name: GetPreferredCaptionLanguage
methods.description: Checks the three-letter ISO 639-2 language terminology code of the preferred caption language set on the Roku device.
methods.returnDescription: The three-letter ISO 639-2 language terminology code, which may be one of the following values:

methods.name: TimeSinceLastKeypress
methods.description: Checks for the number of seconds passed since the last remote keypress.
methods.returnDescription: The number of seconds since the last remote keypress was received.

methods.name: GetDrmInfo
methods.description: Checks for the supported DRM system and its features.
methods.returnDescription: An associative array with the supported DRM system and features. For example, a device that supports PlayReady inside a trusted environment with secure stop returns:

methods.name: GetCaptionsMode
methods.description: Determines whether global captions are turned on or off, or are in instant replay mode.
methods.returnDescription: The current global setting for the Mode property, which may be one of the following values:

methods.name: SetCaptionsMode

params.name: mode
params.description: The current global setting for the Mode property, which may be one of the following values:

methods.description: Sets the current global setting for the Mode property.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the Mode property was successfully set.

methods.name: GetCaptionsOption

params.name: option
params.description: The global setting property to be checked, which may be one of the following values:

methods.description: Checks the current value of the specified global setting property.
methods.returnDescription: The value of the specified global setting property, which may be as follows:

methods.name: GetClockFormat
methods.description: Checks whether the system settings for Time (**Setting > System > Time**) is set to a 12 or 24-hour format.
methods.returnDescription: The time format:

methods.name: EnableAppFocusEvent

params.name: enable
params.description: A flag specifying whether to enable/disable system overlay event notifications.

methods.description: Notifies the channel when a system overlay event (such as the [confirm partner button HUD](/docs/developer-program/getting-started/architecture/channel-manifest.md#special-purpose-attributes) or the caption control overlay) is displayed. This notification gives the channel the opportunity to do any processing they may want to when the channel loses or regains focus.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the system overlay event notifications are enabled (true) or disabled (false).

methods.name: EnableScreensaverExitedEvent

params.name: enable
params.description: A flag specifying whether to enable/disable screensaver exit event notifications.

methods.description: Notifies the channel when a screensaver exit event occurs. This function enables the sending of an [roDeviceInfoEvent](/docs/references/brightscript/events/rodeviceinfoevent.md) when a user has exited the screensaver.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether screensaver exit event notifications are enabled (true) or disabled (false).

methods.name: IsHDMIConnected
methods.description: Checks for an HDMI connection.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether an HDMI connection to a TV has been detected.

methods.name: EnableLowGeneralMemoryEvent
methods.description: Notifies the channel when a lowGeneralMemoryLevel event occurs. This function enables the sending of an [roDeviceInfoEvent](/docs/references/brightscript/events/rodeviceinfoevent.md) when a low general memory event occurs.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether lowGeneralMemoryLevel event notifications are enabled (true) or disabled (false).

methods.name: GetGeneralMemoryLevel
methods.description: Checks the general memory levels of the channel.
methods.returnDescription: Returns the general memory levels of the channel, which may be one of the following values:

methods.name: IsStoreDemoMode
methods.description: Checks whether the device is in demo mode.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the device is in demo mode.

methods.name: GetLinkStatus
methods.description: Checks if the device has an active connection.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the device has an active connection.

methods.name: EnableLinkStatusEvent

params.name: enable
params.description: A flag specifying whether to enable/disable network connection status event notifications.

methods.description: Notifies the channel when a network connection status event occurs. This function enables the sending of an [roDeviceInfoEvent](/docs/references/brightscript/events/rodeviceinfoevent.md) when the network connection status changes. To receive events, you must have first called [SetMessagePort](/docs/references/brightscript/interfaces/ifsetmessageport.md) on the roDeviceInfo object specifying the message port that is to receive the events
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether network connection status event notifications are enabled (true) or disabled (false).

methods.name: GetConnectionType
methods.description: Checks whether the device has a WiFi or wired connection, or if it is not connected through any type of network.
methods.returnDescription: The type of internet connection the device is using. This may be one of the following values:

methods.name: EnableInternetStatusEvent

params.name: enable
params.description: A flag specifying whether to enable/disable network connection status event notifications.

methods.description: Notifies the channel when an internet connection status event occurs. This function enables the sending of an [roDeviceInfoEvent](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/brightscript/events/rodeviceinfoevent.md) when the network connection status changes, as indicated by `roDeviceInfoEvent.internetStatus`. To receive events, the channel must have first called [SetMessagePort](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/brightscript/interfaces/ifsetmessageport.md) on the roDeviceInfo object specifying the message port that is to receive the events.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether network connection status event notifications are enabled (true) or disabled (false).

methods.name: GetInternetStatus
methods.description: Checks the internet connection status of the device.
methods.returnDescription: True if the cached internet status shows a connection; false, otherwise.

methods.name: ForceInternetStatusCheck
methods.description: Forces a new internet connection check. A new check will only be initiated if the cached internet status is older than 10 seconds.
methods.returnDescription: True indicates only that a new internet check has been initiated; otherwise, false. To get the actual internet connection status, use the [**GetInternetStatus()**](getinternetstatus-as-boolean) method.

methods.name: GetExternalIp
methods.description: Checks the IP address assigned to the device by your internet service provider (ISP). This IP address is visible to the internet and all other computers outside your local network.
methods.returnDescription: The external IP address assigned to the device.

methods.name: GetIPAddrs
methods.description: Checks the local IP address of the device. This can be used in conjunction with the ECP (see the External Control Protocol Guide) "launch" command (or the "install" command for uninstalled channels) to start a different channel from the current channel.
methods.returnDescription: An associative array, where each key is the name of a network interface and the value is the IP-address of the interface. Typically, the associative array only contains a single interface.

methods.name: GetConnectionInfo
methods.description: Checks for the information associated with the hardware's connection
methods.returnDescription: An associative array with the following key-value pairs:

methods.name: GetDisplayType
methods.description: Gets the text corresponding to the button selection in the Player Info Settings/Display Type page.
methods.returnDescription: The display type, which may be one of the following values:

methods.name: GetDisplayMode
methods.description: Checks the UI resolution of the device.

This function enables the sending of an [roDeviceInfoEvent](/docs/references/brightscript/events/rodeviceinfoevent.md) when the codec changes. To receive events, you must have first called [SetMessagePort](/docs/references/brightscript/interfaces/ifsetmessageport.md) on the roDeviceInfo object specifying the message port that is to receive the events
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether codec change event notifications are enabled (true) or disabled (false).

To have the text erase the background, make a call to [DrawRect()](#drawrectx-as-integer-y-as-integer-width-as-integer-height-as-integer-rgba-as-integer-as-void) before calling DrawText(). ifEnum.name: ifEnum

methods.name: Reset
methods.description: Resets the current position to the first element of the enumeration.

methods.name: Next
methods.description: Increments the position of an enumeration. If the last element of the enumeration is returned, this method sets the current position to indicate that it is now past the end.
methods.returnDescription: The value at the current position of the enumeration. If the current position is already past the end (that is, the last element has already been returned by a previous call to this method), "invalid" is returned.

methods.name: IsNext
methods.description: Checks whether the current position is not past the end of the enumeration.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the current position is not past the end (true), or is past the end (false).

methods.name: IsEmpty
methods.description: Checks whether the enumeration contains no elements.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the enumeration contains no elements (true), or contains elements (false).

ifEVPCipher.name: ifEVPCipher

methods.name: Setup

params.name: encrypt
params.description: True for encryption; false for decryption

params.name: format
params.description: Cipher format string, from openssl, listed at roEVPCipher

params.name: key
params.description: A hex-encoded key

params.name: iv
params.description: A hex-encoded initialization vector, which can be an empty string

params.name: padding
params.description: 1 to use standard padding; 0 for no padding)

methods.description: Configures and initializes a new cipher context.
methods.returnDescription: Returns 0 on success or non-zero on failure.

methods.name: Reinit
methods.description: Reinitializes an existing cipher context. This can be called to reuse an existing [roEVPCipher](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roevpdigest.md "roEVPCipher") object to encrypt new data
methods.returnDescription: Returns 0 on success or non-zero on failure.

methods.name: Process

params.name: bytes
params.description: An [roByteArray](/docs/references/brightscript/components/robytearray.md) containing data that is encrypted or decrypted.

methods.description: Processes the included [roByteArray](/docs/references/brightscript/components/robytearray.md) containing encrypted/decrypted data.
methods.returnDescription: An [roByteArray](/docs/references/brightscript/components/robytearray.md "roByteArray") containing the result.

methods.name: Update

params.name: bytes
params.description: An [roByteArray](/docs/references/brightscript/components/robytearray.md) containing data that is encrypted or decrypted.

methods.description: Updates the included [roByteArray](/docs/references/brightscript/components/robytearray.md) containing encrypted/decrypted data.
methods.returnDescription: An [roByteArray](/docs/references/brightscript/components/robytearray.md "roByteArray") containing a subset of the result. Some or all of the result may not be returned until the next call to Update().

methods.name: Final
methods.description: Signals that all data has been submitted by previous calls to Update().
methods.returnDescription: The last remaining encrypted or decrypted bytes.

implementors.name: roEVPCipher

methods.description: This method is similar to the [SetLayer()](#setlayerzorder-as-integer-contentlist-as-object-as-void) method, except it takes an [roArray](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roarray.md "roArray") of [roAssociativeArrays](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roassociativearray.md "roAssociativeArrays") instead of just a single [roAssociativeArray](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roassociativearray.md "roAssociativeArray") of [Content Meta-Data](/docs/developer-program/getting-started/architecture/content-metadata.md " Content Meta-Data").

methods.description: If an event object is available, it is returned. Otherwise invalid is returned. The method returns immediately in either case and does not wait.

methods.description: This method is similar to the [GetMessage()](#getmessage-as-dynamic) method, but the returned object (if not invalid) remains in the message queue. A later call to [WaitMessage()](#waitmessagetimeout-as-integer-as-dynamic), [GetMessage()](#getmessage-as-dynamic) or PeekMessage() will return the same message.
methods.returnDescription: An event object.

ifRegex.name: ifRegex

methods.name: IsMatch

params.name: str
params.description: The string to be checked.

methods.description: Checks if a string matches the matching pattern.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the string matches the matching pattern.

methods.name: Match

params.name: str
params.description: The string to be searched for matching substrings.

methods.description: If the matching pattern contains N parenthetical substrings, the relevant substrings are returned as an array of length N+1, where array\[0\] is again the entire match and each additional entry in the array is the match for the corresponding parenthetical expression.
methods.returnDescription: An roArray of matched substrings from str. If no match was made, an empty array is returned. If a match was made, the entire match is returned in array\[0\]. If there are no parenthetical substrings this is the only entry in the array

methods.name: MatchAll

params.name: str
params.description: The string to be searched for matching substrings.

methods.description: Returns all matches of the specific regular expression pattern in the target string.
methods.returnDescription: An roArray where the first element is the full matched string and if there are any capture groups those are returned in subsequent array elements

methods.name: Replace

params.name: str
params.description: The string to be searched.

params.name: replacement
params.description: The string to be used to replace matches in source string.

methods.description: Replaces the first occurrence of a matching pattern in str with replacement and returns the result. The replacement may contain numbered back-references to parenthetical substrings.
methods.returnDescription: A string with the result of the replace operation.

methods.name: ReplaceAll

params.name: str
params.description: The string to be searched.

params.name: replacement
params.description: The string to be used to replace matches in source string.

methods.description: Replaces all occurrences of a matching pattern in str with replacement and returns the result. The replacement may contain numbered back-references to parenthetical substrings.
methods.returnDescription: A string with the result of the replace all operation.

methods.name: Split

params.name: str
params.description: The string to be split.

methods.description: Uses the matching pattern as a separator and splits the string on the separator boundaries.
methods.returnDescription: An roList of substrings of str that were separated by strings which match the pattern in the CreateObject call. The separator strings are not returned. If no matches were found, the returned list contains a single item with the string unchanged.

implementors.name: roRegex
implementors.description: The roRegex component provides the powerful regular expression processing of the PCRE library to Brightscript strings

ifRegex.desription: Checks if a string matches the matching pattern.

ifSGNodeBoundingRect.name: ifSGNodeBoundingRect

methods.name: boundingRect
methods.description: Returns the node bounding rectangle. The bounding rectangle of a node is the axis-aligned rectangle computed by transforming the local bounding rectangle of the node by the node transformation matrix. The resulting rectangle corresponds to the node local bounding rectangle transformed into its parent node local coordinate system.
methods.returnDescription: An associative array with the node bounding rectangle.

methods.name: localBoundingRect
methods.description: Returns the node local bounding rectangle. The local bounding rectangle of a node is the axis-aligned rectangle, that includes the union of the bounding rectangle of the geometry of the node, and the bounding rectangles of all of the node children, transformed into the local coordinate system of the node.
methods.returnDescription: An associative array with the node local bounding rectangle.

methods.name: sceneBoundingRect
methods.description: Returns the bounding rectangle for scene components (component nodes extended from a [Scene](/docs/references/scenegraph/scene.md "Scene") or [OverhangPanelSetScene](/docs/references/scenegraph/sliding-panels-nodes/overhangpanelsetscene.md "OverhangPanelSetScene") node class).
methods.returnDescription: An associative array with the bounding rectangle.

methods.name: localSubBoundingRect

params.name: itemnumber
params.description: The index of the grid item for the local bounding rectangle to be returned in the following format: _rowindex_\__itemindex_.

methods.description: Returns the local bounding rectangle of this node's identified sub part in the node's local coordinate system. If the subpart does not exist, the node's local bounding rectangle is returned.
methods.returnDescription: An associative array with the local bounding rectangle of the node's identified sub part.

methods.name: subBoundingRect

params.name: itemnumber
params.description: The index of the grid item for the local bounding rectangle to be returned in the following format: _rowindex_\__itemindex_.

methods.description: Returns the bounding rectangle of this node's identified sub part, as transformed by this node's transformation matrix, in its parent node's coordinate system. If the subpart does not exist, the node's bounding rectangle is returned.
methods.returnDescription: An associative array with the bounding rectangle.

methods.name: sceneSubBoundingRect

params.name: itemnumber
params.description: The index of the grid item for the bounding rectangle to be returned in the following format: _rowindex_\__itemindex_.

methods.description: Returns the bounding rectangle of this node's subpart in its Scene's coordinate system If the subpart does not exist or if the node is not an ancestor of a Scene node, this will return the node's bounding rectangle.
methods.returnDescription: An associative array with the bounding rectangle.

implementors.name: roSGNode
implementors.description: The roSGNode object is the BrightScript equivalent of SceneGraph XML file node creation

ifSGNodeBoundingRect.desription: The ifSGNodeBoundingRect interface can be used to query the bounding rectangle of subject node. The ifSGNodeBoundingRect interface methods return a node bounding rectangle as an associative array with four elements:

methods.name: findNode

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the node to be retrieved.

methods.description: Returns the node that is a descendant of the nearest component ancestor of the subject node (possibly the subject node itself) and whose id field is set to name. The search for the descendant node is a breadth-first search that includes child nodes in nodes that are declared as custom components defined in other XML component files. These together allow finding siblings and cousins of a node within the context of a component. If a node with the specified name is not found, an invalid object is returned
methods.returnDescription: The node that is a descendant of the nearest component ancestor of the subject node.

methods.description: Puts the slide show into play mode starting from the pause point. Setting the player to play mode when it is not in pause mode generates in error.
